item.title: Tekken Director Katsuhiro Harada Leaves Bandai Namco After 30 Years
item.content:encoded:
Veteran game developer Katsuhiro Harada has announced his departure from Bandai Namco after working on the Tekken franchise for 30 years.

The Tekken franchise has long been one of the pillars of the fighting game genre, and Katsuhiro Harada has been at the heart of it. His goodbye marks the end of an era for the Tekken, but the Tekken 8 team has been quick to shut down any fan concerns regarding the departure of their studio director.

Katsuhiro Harada Leaves Bandai Namco After 30 Years

Harada confirmed his departure in a statement shared online, explaining that the decision came after a period of personal and professional loss. He revealed that the “loss of several close friends” and watching senior colleagues retire or pass away pushed him to reflect deeply on “the time [he] has left as a creator.” After decades spent shaping the world, characters, and legacy of Tekken, he felt the moment was right to close this chapter.

His message also looked back on his early days at Bandai Namco, recalling humble beginnings at local Japanese arcade tournaments and tracing his journey through the studio’s growth and Tekken’s global rise. He thanked fans for their unwavering support and noted that he will share details about his future plans in due course.

You can read his full statement below.

In response to his announcement, the Tekken development team issued their own statement, assuring players that Harada’s departure will not impact Tekken 8’s ongoing development or post-launch roadmap. They emphasised their commitment to continuing the series “with the vision and spirit built by Harada-san,” promising to keep community feedback at the core of their approach as Tekken moves into its next era.

It’s a momentous day for Tekken fans, but Harada gave his all for the franchise. Share your thoughts about the future of Tekken in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more gaming news, check out when Fallout Season 3 is set to start filming, as well as Resident Evil Requiem’s new playable character.

item.title: Rope Battles Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Rope Battles monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Coins, Diamonds and much more.

Rope Battles is a Roblox game that sounds rather simple as players are placed in an intense combat arena where they use ropes, traps, items and whatever they can find to battle others. While it sounds like a rather easy game, players need to strategically master various rope techniques, timing, and special abilities to outmanoeuvre opponents. The main objective of the game is to create the ultimate rope fighter and battle against friends or other players to test your skills.

Progression in Rope Battles revolves around improving your fighter and collecting the game’s two main currencies: Coins and Diamonds. Like most Roblox games, they are the player’s main resources within the Rope Battles universe and allow them to improve their fighter by buying new ropes, items and more. And so, because earning coins (and diamonds) purely through playing can be slow, redeeming official codes is a major boost — codes give you free Coins, sometimes Diamonds, or even spins.

Active Rope Battles Codes

Expired Rope Battles Codes

  • RJHA9O
  • 6LD7FP
  • RBVCFU
  • IIM2RG
  • ILCYTO
  • X9M4YD
  • PFPIO0

How To Redeem Rope Battles Codes

Redeeming codes in Crash Bots is a fairly straightforward process with no prerequisite steps. However, for players who may be new to the Roblox ecosystem, here’s a detailed step-by-step guide to redeeming Crash Bots codes:

  1. Launch Rope Battles on Roblox.
  2. Click the Code button in the upper-right corner of the screen.
  3. Enter a code into the pop-up text box.
  4. Press Claim and enjoy your rewards.

How To Get More Rope Battles Codes

Rope Battles codes can usually be found on the game’s official Discord server, on the Roblox game page, and sometimes on the developer’s social media pages. That includes the Reworld Makers community on Roblox, which you’ll need to join to access some codes. However, keeping track of the various sources can be time-consuming, especially with no system in place to tell users when the codes expire.

Thus, we suggest bookmarking this guide in your browser, as we refresh it as soon as new Rope Battles codes are released and remove expired codes once they are no longer valid.

item.title: StarLadder Budapest Major Playoffs Locked In with Final Eight Teams
item.content:encoded:
The StarLadder Budapest Major 2025 playoffs are set, with eight of the world’s best Counter-Strike 2 teams pushing into the single-elimination bracket after three qualifying stages. There’s a $500,000 grand prize up for grabs, but only one of the eight teams in the playoffs will walk away with the trophy.

Read on to learn everything you need to know about the StarLadder Budapest Major playoffs, including top predictions.

The tournament is almost too close to call. Insider Gaming, together with the international betting brand GG.BET, brings you to the heart of unforgettable moments of the Starladder Major Budapest 2025. Visit gg.bet to dive deeper, place your bets, and feel the adrenaline of esports!

Budapest Major Playoff Predictions Are Set

The StarLadder Budapest Major will run from December 11 – 14 and will feature a single-elimination bracket featuring eight of the best Counter-Strike teams in the business. Leading up to the grand final, every match will be a typical best-of-three run, while the grand final itself is more meaty with a best-of-five requirement.

The confirmed matches to start the Budapest Major playoffs have been locked in:

December 11

  • Vitality vs. The MongolZ
  • Team Spirit vs. Team Falcons

December 12

  • MOUZ vs. FaZe
  • FURIA vs. Natus Vincere

In terms of predictions, both Team Spirit and FURIA found a spot in the playoffs from flawless runs through the tournament’s third stage. They’re the favorites to scoop the trophy and the half-million-dollar prize.

In terms of the next stage, it’s easy to see the teams that are most likely going to make it through. It’

It’s a solid bet to assume that the semifinals will consist of Vitality, Team Spirit, FaZe, and FURIA. Looking even further, it’s easy to see a Team Spirit vs. FaZe Clan final, but only time will tell.

Let us know your predictions for the StarLadder Budapest Major on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out how FURIA managed to secure a playoff spot

item.title: Fallout Season 3 Aiming to Start Filming in Summer 2026
item.content:encoded:
Season 3 of Prime Video’s Fallout may be filming as soon as Summer 2026, should one executive’s hopes come true. Its second season is only weeks away and, with a third season already in production, fans seemingly won’t have to wait long to return to the wasteland.

In the world of great adaptations, none came more of a surprise than Prime Video’s Fallout. Based on the post-apocalyptic worlds from Bethesda, the series goes its own route yet keeps the action, heart, and comedy of the games. Released in 2024, the series was a smash hit with fans and critics. In fact, it was nominated for several Emmys, including Best Drama and Best Drama Actor for Walton Goggins. A second season was quickly greenlit, now set in the vibrant New Vegas. With its release on December 17th, fans already can’t wait to see more. Fortunately, it seems filming is happening sooner than expected.

Prime Video Fallout’s Creator ‘Hoping to be Shooting’ Season 3 in Summer 2026

In an interview for IGN, series creator Jonathan Nolan and showrunner Geneva Robertson-Dworet chatted about Season 2. At the tail-end of the interview, at around 17:50, a question about Season 3 and possible locales was asked. In response, Jonathan Nolan stated,

“Well, I say with regards to production, we’re hoping to be shooting again next summer,” says Nolan in the interview. “We’ll see if that all comes together, best laid plans and all. I’m excited that, though the scope of the show feels undiminished season on season, Geneva and Graham and our incredibly talented cast and crew were able to work quickly enough to get back on the air in a reasonable amount of time. I think what’s happened with television, in terms of taking longer and longer from season to season, is kind of an unfortunate trend. You don’t want the show to lose any of its scope, but we know that we like to be back on the air as soon as we can.”

Despite Nolan’s comment, it seems a Summer 2026 filming date is not yet set in stone, so nothing is confirmed just yet. A third season was greenlit back in March 2025 after filming wrapped on the second season and seemingly started production then. If it does film in Summer 2026, fans could see the third season release as soon as Spring 2027, if all goes well. It’s too soon to say where the story will go with it, but given how well the first season did, it seems it’ll be in good hands. Either way, the December 17th release for Prime Video’s Fallout can’t come soon enough.

What do you think of Fallout Season 3 possibly shooting in Summer 2026? Is it too soon? Where do you hope the show goes next? Leave a comment below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Fallout, check out the coverage on Todd Howard’s relation to the series and Fallout 5. Make sure to subscribe to the weekly newsletter!
